title: Nigeria: BOI Secures U.S.$100 Million Loan for SMEs in Nigeria
text:
Burkina Faso: Govt Disbands Unit Behind Failed Coup 
Bank of Industry (BOI) has secured a $100 million loan from the African Development Bank (AfDB) to aid its development financing objectives to Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) in Nigeria. 
The bank gave the hint in a statement, saying the AfDB loan for SMEs engaged in export-oriented businesses was the first foreign-sourced facility accessed by BoI after its reconstruction in 2001. 
It stated that the first loan instalment of $50 million was recently disbursed by AfDB targeted at SMEs, and that the credit approval for implementation of bank's strategies and plans was also received. 
"The facility is set to tackle the financial challenges facing Nigerian SMEs in the export sector. The loan will enhance their operations and reposition them for expansion and business growth which will spiral into growth in their industry," the bank explained. 
BOI has contracted an international firm, Messrs BDO/GBRW, based on African Development Bank's quality selection procedure, to render capacity building services to its staff and prospective SMEs to help deepen the impact of the loan facility. Nigeria
